pointcloud¶

pointcloud.py holds the CloudInfo class, the integral object type of PyFor.

class pointcloud.CloudInfo(filename)¶

Holds and manipulates the data from a .las point cloud.

cell_sort()¶

Sorts cells into grid constructed by grid_constructor by appending cell_x & cell_y to self.dataframe.

generate_BEM(step, out_path)¶

User-end function that creates a bare earth model

grid_constructor(step, output=False)¶

Sets self.grid to a list of tuples corresponding to the points of a 2D grid covering the extent of the input .las

Parameters:
  • step – Length of grid cell side in same units as .las
  • output – If true, generates an ESRI shapefile of the grid, not used for any processes in Pyfor.
ground_classify(method='simple', output=False)¶

Classifies points in self.dataframe as 2 using a simple ground filter.

Parameters:
  • method – Ground filtering method (to be implemented, default is currently simple)
  • output – If true, generates a .las of the classified ground points.
normalize(dem_path, export=False, path=None)¶

Subtracts the underlying elevation from the CloudInfo object given some input GeoTIFF DEM.

Keyword arguments: :param dem_path: Resolution of output raster (same units as .las) :param export: Exports the normalized cloud as a new las file with name path. :param path: The name of the export file.

point_cloud_to_dem(path)¶

Holds a variety of functions that create a GeoTIFF from a classified point cloud.

Parameters:path – output path for GeoTIFF output.
rasterize(resolution, func, out_path)¶

Rasterizes a summary function over the grouped dataframe.

Parameters:
  • resolution – Resolution of output raster (same units as .las)
  • func – The numpy function to apply to the gridded las
  • path – The output path of the new GeoTIFF
